verses.korean: "그때 많은 사람들이 남쪽 왕을 대적하고 일어설 거야."

verses.original: So the king of the north will come and cast up a mound, and take a well-fortified city. The forces of the south won’t stand, neither will his chosen people, neither will there be any strength to stand.
verses.korean: "북쪽 왕이 와서 튼튼한 성을 차지할 거야."

verses.original: But he who comes against him will do according to his own will, and no one will stand before him. He will stand in the glorious land, and destruction will be in his hand.
verses.korean: "공격하는 자가 마음대로 할 거야. 아무도 그를 막지 못할 거야."

verses.original: He will set his face to come with the strength of his whole kingdom, and with him equitable conditions. He will perform them. He will give him the daughter of women, to corrupt her; but she will not stand, and won’t be for him.
verses.korean: "그가 온 나라의 힘을 가지고 오려고 할 거야."

verses.original: After this he will turn his face to the islands, and will take many; but a prince will cause the reproach offered by him to cease. Yes, moreover, he will cause his reproach to turn on him.
verses.korean: "그 후에 그가 바다 건너 섬들을 향해 많이 빼앗을 거야."

verses.original: Then he will turn his face toward the fortresses of his own land; but he will stumble and fall, and won’t be found.
verses.korean: "그러고 나서 자기 땅의 요새로 돌아갈 거야. 하지만 그는 넘어지고 쓰러질 거야."

verses.original: “Then one who will cause a tax collector to pass through the kingdom to maintain its glory will stand up in his place; but within few days he shall be destroyed, not in anger, and not in battle.
verses.korean: "그 자리에 세금을 걷는 자를 보내는 왕이 일어날 거야."

verses.original: “In his place a contemptible person will stand up, to whom they had not given the honor of the kingdom; but he will come in time of security, and will obtain the kingdom by flatteries.
verses.korean: "그 자리에 비열한 사람이 일어날 거야. 사람들은 그에게 왕의 영광을 주지 않았지만 그가 평화로울 때 슬쩍 들어올 거야."

verses.original: The overwhelming forces will be overwhelmed from before him, and will be broken. Yes, also the prince of the covenant.
verses.korean: "큰 군대가 그 앞에서 쓸려갈 거야."

verses.original: After the treaty made with him he will work deceitfully; for he will come up, and will become strong, with a small people.
verses.korean: "그가 조약을 맺은 후에 속임수를 쓸 거야."

verses.original: In time of security he will come even on the fattest places of the province. He will do that which his fathers have not done, nor his fathers’ fathers. He will scatter among them prey, plunder, and substance. Yes, he will devise his plans against the strongholds, even for a time.
verses.korean: "평화로울 때 그가 가장 좋은 지방으로 들어올 거야."

verses.original: “He will stir up his power and his courage against the king of the south with a great army; and the king of the south will wage war in battle with an exceedingly great and mighty army; but he won’t stand; for they will devise plans against him.
verses.korean: "그가 큰 군대로 남쪽 왕을 적할 거야."

verses.original: Yes, those who eat of his dainties will destroy him, and his army will be swept away. Many will fall down slain.
verses.korean: "그와 함께 먹던 자들이 그를 무너뜨릴 거야. 많은 사람이 쓰러질 거야."

verses.original: As for both these kings, their hearts will be to do mischief, and they will speak lies at one table; but it won’t prosper, for the end will still be at the appointed time.
verses.korean: "두 왕이 나쁜 마음을 품고 한 식탁에서 거짓말을 할 거야."

verses.original: Then he will return into his land with great wealth. His heart will be against the holy covenant. He will take action, and return to his own land.
verses.korean: "북쪽 왕이 많은 재물을 가지고 자기 땅으로 돌아갈 거야. 그의 마음은 거룩한 약속을 적할 거야."

verses.original: “He will return at the appointed time, and come into the south; but it won’t be in the latter time as it was in the former.
verses.korean: "정한 때에 그가 다시 남쪽으로 올 거야. 하지만 이번에는 전과 같지 않을 거야."

verses.original: For ships of Kittim will come against him. Therefore he will be grieved, and will return, and have indignation against the holy covenant, and will take action. He will even return, and have regard to those who forsake the holy covenant.
verses.korean: "깃딤의 배들이 그를 적할 거야. 그래서 그가 낙심하고 돌아갈 거야. 거룩한 약속을 미워할 거야."

verses.original: “Forces will stand on his part, and they will profane the sanctuary, even the fortress, and will take away the continual burnt offering. Then they will set up the abomination that makes desolate.
verses.korean: "그의 군대가 일어나서 성전을 더럽힐 거야. 그러고 나서 끔찍한 것을 세울 거야."

verses.original: He will corrupt those who do wickedly against the covenant by flatteries; but the people who know their God will be strong, and take action.
verses.korean: "약속을 어기는 자들을 아첨으로 타락시킬 거야. 하지만 하나님을 아는 백성은 강하게 설 거야."

verses.original: “Those who are wise among the people will instruct many; yet they will fall by the sword and by flame, by captivity and by plunder, many days.
verses.korean: "백성 중에 지혜로운 자들이 많은 사람을 가르칠 거야. 하지만 오랫동안 칼과 불과 잡혀간 사람됨으로 쓰러질 거야."

verses.original: Now when they fall, they will be helped with a little help; but many will join themselves to them with flatteries.
verses.korean: "그들이 쓰러질 때 작은 도움을 받을 거야. 하지만 많은 사람이 거짓으로 그들에게 붙을 거야."

verses.original: Some of those who are wise will fall, to refine them, and to purify, and to make them white, even to the time of the end; because it is yet for the time appointed.
verses.korean: "지혜로운 자들 중 일부가 쓰러질 거야. 그것은 그들을 깨끗하게 하고 깨끗하게 하려는 거야. 끝 때까지 말이야."

verses.original: “The king will do according to his will. He will exalt himself, and magnify himself above every god, and will speak marvelous things against the God of gods. He will prosper until the indignation is accomplished; for that which is determined will be done.
verses.korean: "그 왕은 마음대로 할 거야. 자기를 높여서 모든 신보다 위에 있다고 할 거야. 신들의 신을 대적하여 놀라운 말을 할 거야."

verses.original: He won’t regard the gods of his fathers, or the desire of women, or regard any god; for he will magnify himself above all.
verses.korean: "그는 조상들의 신들을 존경하지 않을 거야. 어떤 신도 존경하지 않을 거야. 자기를 모든 것 위에 높일 거야."

verses.original: But in his place he will honor the god of fortresses. He will honor a god whom his fathers didn’t know with gold, silver, and with precious stones and pleasant things.
verses.korean: "대신 요새의 신을 공경할 거야. 조상들이 알지 못하던 신을 공경할 거야."

verses.original: He will deal with the strongest fortresses by the help of a foreign god. He will increase with glory whoever acknowledges him. He will cause them to rule over many, and will divide the land for a price.
verses.korean: "이상한 신의 도움으로 가장 튼튼한 요새들을 다룰 거야."

verses.original: “At the time of the end the king of the south will contend with him; and the king of the north will come against him like a whirlwind, with chariots, with horsemen, and with many ships. He will enter into the countries, and will overflow and pass through.
verses.korean: "끝 때에 남쪽 왕이 그와 싸울 거야. 북쪽 왕이 회오리바람처럼 달려올 거야."

verses.original: He will enter also into the glorious land, and many countries will be overthrown; but these will be delivered out of his hand: Edom, Moab, and the chief of the children of Ammon.
verses.korean: "그가 아름다운 땅에도 들어올 거야. 많은 나라가 무너질 거야."

verses.original: He will also stretch out his hand on the countries. The land of Egypt won’t escape.
verses.korean: "그가 여러 나라에 손을 뻗칠 거야. 이집트 땅도 피하지 못할 거야."

verses.original: But he will have power over the treasures of gold and of silver, and over all the precious things of Egypt. The Libyans and the Ethiopians will be at his steps.
verses.korean: "그가 금과 은 보물을 다스릴 거야."

verses.original: But news out of the east and out of the north will trouble him; and he will go out with great fury to destroy and utterly to sweep away many.
verses.korean: "하지만 동쪽과 북쪽에서 오는 소식이 그를 놀라게 할 거야."

verses.original: He will plant the tents of his palace between the sea and the glorious holy mountain; yet he will come to his end, and no one will help him.
verses.korean: "그가 바다와 거룩한 산 사이에 자기 궁전 천막을 칠 거야. 하지만 그는 끝이 올 거야."

verses.original: “At that time Michael will stand up, the great prince who stands for the children of your people; and there will be a time of trouble, such as never was since there was a nation even to that same time. At that time your people will be delivered, everyone who is found written in the book.
verses.korean: "그때에 위대한 천사장 미가엘이 일어설 거야. 미가엘은 네 백성을 지켜 주는 분이야. 힘든 때가 올 거야."

verses.original: Many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth will awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt.
verses.korean: "땅의 티끌 속에서 자는 많은 사람들이 깨어날 거야. 어떤 사람들은 영원한 생명으로, 어떤 사람들은 영원한 수치로 깨어날 거야."

verses.original: Those who are wise will shine as the brightness of the expanse. Those who turn many to righteousness will shine as the stars forever and ever.
verses.korean: "지혜로운 사람들은 하늘처럼 밝게 빛날 거야. 많은 사람을 의롭게 인도한 사람들은 별처럼 영원히 빛날 거야."

verses.original: But you, Daniel, shut up the words, and seal the book, even to the time of the end. Many will run back and forth, and knowledge will be increased.”
verses.korean: "다니엘아, 이 말씀들을 간직하고 이 책을 봉하여라. 끝 때까지 말이야. 많은 사람들이 여기저기 다니며 지식이 늘어날 거야."

verses.original: Then I, Daniel, looked, and behold, two others stood, one on the river bank on this side, and the other on the river bank on that side.
verses.korean: 그때 다니엘이 보니, 다른 두 사람이 서 있었어요. 한 사람은 강 이쪽에, 한 사람은 강 저쪽에 있었어요.

verses.original: One said to the man clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, “How long will it be to the end of these wonders?”
verses.korean: 한 사람이 세마포 옷을 입은 분에게 물었어요. "이 놀라운 일들이 끝나려면 얼마나 걸릴까요?"

verses.original: I heard the man clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, when he held up his right hand and his left hand to heaven, and swore by him who lives forever that it will be for a time, times, and a half; and when they have finished breaking in pieces the power of the holy people, all these things will be finished.
verses.korean: 세마포 옷을 입은 분이 오른손과 왼손을 하늘로 들고 영원히 사시는 분의 이름으로 맹세했어요.

verses.original: I heard, but I didn’t understand. Then I said, “My lord, what will be the outcome of these things?”
verses.korean: 다니엘은 들었지만 이해하지 못했어요. 그래서 물었어요. "나의 주여, 이 일들의 결과가 어떻게 될까요?"

verses.original: He said, “Go your way, Daniel; for the words are shut up and sealed until the time of the end.
verses.korean: 그 분이 말씀하셨어요. "다니엘아, 네 갈 길을 가거라. 이 말씀들은 끝 때까지 닫혀 있고 봉해져 있단다."

verses.original: Many will purify themselves, and make themselves white, and be refined; but the wicked will do wickedly; and none of the wicked will understand; but those who are wise will understand.
verses.korean: "많은 사람들이 자신을 깨끗하게 하고 깨끗하게 할 거야. 하지만 악한 자들은 계속 악을 행할 거야."

verses.original: “From the time that the continual burnt offering is taken away, and the abomination that makes desolate set up, there will be one thousand two hundred ninety days.
verses.korean: "매일 드리는 다 태워 드리는 제사를 멈추고 끔찍한 것을 세울 때부터 1,290일이 지날 거야."

verses.original: Blessed is he who waits, and comes to the one thousand three hundred thirty-five days.
verses.korean: "1,335일까지 기다리는 사람은 복이 있을 거야."

verses.original: “But go you your way until the end; for you will rest, and will stand in your inheritance at the end of the days.”
verses.korean: "다니엘아, 너는 끝까지 네 갈 길을 가거라. 너는 쉬게 될 거야. 그리고 마지막 날에 일어나 네 몫을 받게 될 거야."
